Runebound

@UUID[Compendium.forien-armoury.forien-homerules.JournalEntry.Gkp2fY7NEJJ3FlGe.JournalEntryPage.3Xv2geVQ88IDZ8Ey]{Runebounds} are artificially enhanced humans. They are result of multiple types of experiments made by dwarven Runesmiths and arcane wizards within the @UUID[Compendium.forien-armoury.forien-homerules.JournalEntry.Gkp2fY7NEJJ3FlGe.JournalEntryPage.lgV5sjVAWAZN1WCk]{Hunters' Guild}. Goal of these experiments was to make ultimate soldiers to fight the Chaos Beasts and hordes of Undead with ease.

On the most basic and simplified level, Runebounds are merged with a magic, which mutates them and becomes inseparable part of Runebound. Thanks to that they gain new abilities and ability to use magic. But to many, they are no longer considered human and are simply mutants, heretics, monsters to be hunted.

Creating a Runebound Character

Since one cannot be born a Runebound, but only transition so from Human. However, to make this new species in line with the mechanics of the game, we will mechanically treat it as separate species.

Becoming a Runebound

Transitioning from Human to Runebound is dangerous and highly discouraged. It involves months of drug and magic therapy that is more than likely to destroy bodies of most men. And even if they survive, it cannot be guaranteed the same for their mind and soul.

Mechanically, a Character transitioning needs to complete an Average Extended Toughness Test with target SL being equal to double the age in years, but no less than 20. You can attempt one roll towards the Extended Test per in-game week. If at any point, total SL of this test falls into negatives, character dies (or mutates beyond recognition and becomes a chaos spawn, up to GM). Same happens if any of the rolls Fumbles.

After a Character completes the Extended Toughness Test, they need to perform a Hard (-20) Willpower Test. If they fail, immediately gain one mental corruption.

Benefits of becoming a Runebound

When you become a Runebound, immediately gain following Talents/Traits. If you already have one of these talents you can take another level or reroll, up to you.

Talents: Mutation*, 4 Random Talents

* Since becoming a Runebound is somewhat controlled ritual, Mutations gained at this point are mostly aesthetics. Choose one that's cool, but be ready for consequences. If GM decides, they can modify your characteristics by up to -3/+3.

Additionally, when you become a Runebound, you change some of your characteristics:

  • Add +5 to all basic Characteristics except Fel and Int, both of which suffer -5

  • Reset Movement to 4,

  • Lower Resilience to 2,

  • Lower Fate to 1,

  • Gain +1 extra point to assign to Resilience or Fate.

Negatives of being a Runebound

Runebounds are OP. They are meant to be. After all, they were created to be super-human beast-fighting monsters. However, they are arguably more dangerous character to play than any other.

  • Runebounds are actively being hunted by many, including some rogue or self-righteous Witch Hunters and Wizards. If your GM decided that Monster Hunter Guild is operating publicly in your World, then Runebound should have a "license", but this still won't stop all of the Witch Hunters.

  • From the common folk point of view, Runebounds are not that different from Mutants, Cultists and Heretics. Unknown must mean Ruinous Powers after all! Common Folk fears and sometimes even hates Runebounds. Try to hide your mutations in public!

  • You can never gain talents like Arcane Magic, Petty Magic, Chaos Magic, Invoke, Bless etc. If you were to try and use magic or any other mystical power in other way than a Runebound Magic, your body would disintegrate.

  • You are sterile, you can never have offspring
